name: Lighthouse
description: Embed Google Lighthouse HTML result in Azure Pipelines
author: GSoft
helpMarkDown: Embed Google Lighthouse HTML reports in Azure Pipelines. You can provide the lighthouse NPM package, otherwise it will be installed in a temporary directory.

inputs.name: args
inputs.label: CLI arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The [CLI arguments](https://github.com/GoogleChrome/lighthouse) to pass to Lighthouse. One argument per line.

`--view`, `--output`, `--output-path`, `--chrome-flags` are prohibited and will be either removed or replaced.

inputs.name: evaluateAuditRules
inputs.label: Enable audit score evaluation
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Allow you to write audit score rules that will be evaluated. The task will fail if any rule fails.
You can find the [list of available audits here](https://github.com/gsoft-inc/azure-pipelines-lighthouse#available-audits)

inputs.name: auditRulesStr
inputs.label: Audit rules
inputs.helpMarkDown:
One rule per line. Rule formatting:
`some-audit-id = 1` (expect score of `some-audit-id` to be equal to 1)
`my-audit-id > 0.5` (expect score of `some-audit-id` to be greater than 0.5)
`my-audit-id < 0.5` (expect score of `some-audit-id` to be lower than 0.5)

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you already have Lighthouse installed on the agent and want to use it, specify here the location of the `node_modules` folder.
